name: One Up - Banana Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the One Up for 6 nights and couldn't have been happier. Arun and his team provide an outstanding service. The hotel is well located, conceived and appointed. The rooms are spacious with all amenities one would expect. The beds aren't as firm as others we have experienced in SE Asia. The staff helped booking buses and the hotel's trusty tuc tuc driver took us everywhere we wanted for a very reasonable cost. It is bice to stay somewhere with a social concience. All in all one of the best hotel experiences we have had and great value for money, what more could one ask!?
reviews.title: Pick of the bunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in the smart end of town near busy roads full of bars and restaurants but just tucked off the end of the road makes it feel like an oasis of calm. Amazing customer service, greeted with lovely iced drink and recognised everytime we came back. Manager always had time to talk with us and ask us about our day. Very helpful arranging tuktuk tour and with local area info. Can pay more for English speaking driver but not sure what they would add and our driver spoke more than enough. We paid $20 and were taken to prison s-21, killing fields and Russian market. Then dropped back at hotel before being taken to water front in early evening and picked up after dinner. Roof top terrace nice for a sundowner. Be aware 2 of the rooms are on ground floor by reception. We didn't experience any undue noise though and there is 24hr reception so felt safe. Rooms are large and clean. Breakfast is optional extra which can be delivered to your room but relatively pricey and lots of other breakfast options in easy walk.
reviews.title: Tucked away from the chaos

reviews.text: Very clean and nicely decorated room .
reviews.title: An oasis in Phnom Penh

reviews.text: Really comfy place with friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Best Hotel In Cambodia
I loved it!
reviews.text: There is a kitchenette,balcony,safe,fridge,flat TV screen .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the heart of a Phnom Penh.
reviews.title: A Little Haven........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it here for various reasons.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a great spot, it's quiet, spotlessly clean and has lovely helpful staff.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: ROOM 2 is beautifully furnished but tiny.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Phnom Penh

reviews.text: Small balcony off the bedroom hints of more space.
reviews.title: Luxury for a backpacker

reviews.text: We arrived at One Up Banana Hotel in the evening and stayed for 2 nights on the 15 - 16 Sept. Our room are located on the 1st floor. The room are in good condition, clean, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is good and there are lots of restaurants, cafe. Tuk-tuk are easily available to travel around the city. Our thanks to Arun and his staff for making our stay so pleasant. Will recommend friends to stay.
reviews.title: Small Hotel with Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay at 1-Up every time I come o Phnom Penh and, although I call it my home from home, it is actually rather nicer than my home back in London. The staff, managed byt the wonderfully accommodating, helpful and friendly Arun, could not be more helpful and without being overbearing. Great customer service is what the staff strive for, and they achieve it with aplomb. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff (who act as a family rather than a work team) is evident from the housekeeping guys and girls up to the manager.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful and comfortable and it is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city so they are also quiet.
reviews.title: Fantasic Service
Excellent place!
reviews.text: This will be the fifth time I have stayed here; the first when it first opened a couple of years ago and each time i return, the amenities, decor and general feel of the place just get better and better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i really cannot compliment 1-up too highly. I would stay nowhere else in PP and look froward to my return each time i come back to the city. You are doing yourself a disservice if you stay anywhere else in PP at this price range - it is great, not just by Khmer standards but by international standards. Excellent place to stay.
reviews.title: A great small hotel made excellent by the staff.

reviews.text: Great location. Take taxi on your own from airport costs $9. Tut tut around town is $3. Walking distance to main areas of town if you like walking which we did. Free Wii fi a bonus. Does the job. Rooms are small with an atrium separating bathroom allowing the rooms to have a/c when you shut the door
reviews.title: Great value. All you need

reviews.text: I had a very pleasurable stay at One Up Banana Hotel. It is a very comfortable hotel, also new and clean. Staffs there were very hospitable and accommodating to all my queries and needs. Also the tuktuk for the day tour is relatively cheap and very good. I love my room very much, especially the number of pillows. That is one of my favorite as well as the bidet at the toilet. Because most of the hotels doesn't provide enough pillows and don't have bidets. Overall, One Up Banana Hotel is a great hotel and I will definitely recommend to all my friends going to Phnom Phen. Please continue in becoming the number 1 hotel in PP. Thumbs up for your guys!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in PP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value hotel but what makes it recommendable are the staff. Nothing was too much trouble and they always greeted you with a smile and asked how your day / evening was. They organised tuk tuks and transport to Siem Reap, all went smoothly and on time. Roof terrace is lovely. Great for breakfast or to relax with a book after a busy day sight seeing. Hotel location is a bit away from the main night life area but that makes it quiet. Tuk tuks are so cheap if you do want to hit the town.
reviews.title: Fantastic friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are fantastic and really and make this hotel what it is. They are so welcoming, helpful with nothing being too much trouble. It has a lovely roof top terrace and our room was large and spotlessly clean with everything you would expect (air-con, cable tv, fantastic shower and free bottled water daily).
reviews.title: Perfect stay at Up One Banana...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took them up on their offer of a tuk-tuk driver for the day (whose name I can't remember -sorry!), but again he was brilliant and for only $20 ferried us around all day. They also booked our onward bus journey to Siem Reap letting us wait in our room until they came to pick us up even though we had checked out!
reviews.title: wonderful hotel with exceptional staff and management

description: We have 14 great rooms, two with private balcony, and two on our beautiful rooftop. All our rooms feature: Mini Bar, Air Conditioning, In-room WiFi, 32" LCD TV, Kitchenette with fridge, Kettle Tea and coffee in room, Walk-in shower with hot water, Daily cleaning service, 24-hour security.
